page.title: 02CHEW VALLEY LAKE GENERAL
page.content: The project for this man made lake was started in 1950 and officially opened in 1956 by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth Over 1200 acres of farm land were flooded and Denny Island was formed. Over nine farms were covered by the combined waters of the dammed River Chew and tributaries.Some farms are remembered by such names as Moreton Point and Denny Island. Stratford Bay is named after a mill now removed to Blaise Castle,Bristol. Roman Shallows hide a Roman Road and Villa site. Nunnery Point is near the foundations of the Nunnery of St.Cross.Excavations uncovered many artifacts now in Bristol Museum.The Lake's capacity is 4,500 million gallons.10 million gallons feed daily to Bristol,Bath and Barrow Tanks.A conduit takes the over- flow back to the River Chew.
